definition: to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement

sentences.english: The rise of global history has aroused widespread attention in the history profession around the world.
sentences.chinese: 全球史的勃兴已经引起国际史坛的广泛瞩目。

sentences.english: III. Globalization and the plight and revival of socialism.
sentences.chinese: 全球化与社会主义的困境和勃兴。

sentences.english: To the Han and Tang, doubt about history detection of forgeries of the wind is flourishing.
sentences.chinese: 到了汉唐，疑古辨伪之风更是勃兴。

sentences.english: The boom’s third driving force is the rapid globalisation of the industry.
sentences.chinese: 这一轮勃兴的第三大驱动力就是快速的工业全球化。

sentences.english: The development of travels literary works is closely related with the process of the humanized natural .
sentences.chinese: 游观文学的勃兴与自然的“人性化”过程紧密相联。

definition: to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
vestigial residue/a throwback (to a former age)
